item.title: No change in Hilbert space fundamentalism
item.description: arXiv:2602.20331v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: Hilbert space fundamentalism (HSF) states that everything about the physical world is encoded in the Hamiltonian operator and the state vector (as a unit vector, not a wavefunction, which requires additional specification of a configuration space, a position basis, or the position observables). That all structures needed to describe reality, including subsystems, space, fields, emerge from these. I show that HSF can't account for our observations that the physical world changes in time.
item.dc:creator: Ovidiu Cristinel Stoica
